com.github.katjahahn.tools

Class ShannonEntropy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.tools.ShannonEntropy

  • public class ShannonEntropy
extends java.lang.Object
    Tool to calculate Shannon's Entropy for entire files, byte arrays or sections of a PE.

    Example code: 

     {@code
 File file = new File("WinRar.exe");
 PEData data = PELoader.loadPE(file);
 ShannonEntropy entropy = new ShannonEntropy(data);
 int sectionNr = 1;
 System.out.println("Entropy for section " + sectionNr + ": " + entropy.forSection(sectionNr));
 }

      • entropy

        public static double entropy(java.io.File file,
             long offset,
             long size)
        Calculates Shannon's Entropy for the specified part of the file

        Parameters:
        file - the file to calculate the entropy from
        offset - the offset to start calculating the entropy from
        size - the number of bytes that make up the part of the file that is used to calculate the entropy from
        Returns:
        Shannon's Entropy for the part of the file specified by offset and size

      • forFile

        public double forFile()
        Calculates Shannon's Entropy for the file

        Returns:
        Shannon's Entropy for the file

      • forSection

        public double forSection(int sectionNumber)
        Calculates the entropy for the section with the sectionNumber.

        Parameters:
        sectioNumber - number of the section
        Returns:
        entropy of the section

      • forSections

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> forSections()
        Calculates the entropy for all sections of the file and returns a map with the section numbers as keys and their entropy as values.

        Returns:
        map with section number as keys and entropy as values
